Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Nine Months
Dziewięć miesięcy
Nine Months
programme.desc:
Nine Months: Directed by Chris Columbus. With Hugh Grant, Julianne Moore, Tom Arnold, Joan Cusack. When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113986/","name":"Nine Months","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2U3YTQzYWYtZTBlYi00ZmJjLTkzMjAtOTljYmE5MThhNzk5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113986/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philip_vanderveken"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just a poor girl movie","reviewBody":"Thanks a lot Hollywood for making me feel like I'm not worth much. No, I'm not a father yet, but if my girlfriend would tell me that she's pregnant, my world would probably almost collapse at the first moment and apparently that's not the way you should react. This movie tries to make you believe that having a child is everybody's moral duty. We all should make a few dozen babies to find eternal happiness. I'm very sorry but that is just a bunch of ultra conservative Christian crap!!! I know, my reaction is perhaps a bit strong, but this time it all really bothered me too much.

At first the movie starts very promising. It's funny to see how he reacts when he hears the news that she's pregnant, that his perfectly organized life will be completely turned upside down, ... but as the movie progresses it gets a pedantic tone, which I really didn't like. I agree that the movie had funny parts (for instance the praying mantis part was absolutely brilliant), but it never seemed to stick to a certain genre. Sometimes it was slapstick, than drama, than comedy, than a romantic movie... What bothered me about this movie as well, is the use of so many stereotypes. Men are pigs when it comes to having children, babies are miracles, a man acts and reacts like a child... 

All in all this is just a poor girl movie that confirms many of their ideas about men and children. It has some decent, but far from excellent acting in it, but doesn't know where it wants to go. I give it a 5/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36215,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1995-07-12","keywords":"time for title,bad dream,close up of eyes,close up of lips,close up of mouth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Nine Months","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2812084505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjljYWMxZTUtNTQxYy00Yjc2LWI3MDEtYTNiYTQzMDZiMzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjljYWMxZTUtNTQxYy00Yjc2LWI3MDEtYTNiYTQzMDZiMzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000424/","name":"Hugh Grant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000792/","name":"Tom Arnold"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0105317/","name":"Patrick Braoudé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wild Rose
Siła marzeń
Wild Rose
programme.desc:
Wild Rose: Directed by Tom Harper. With Jessie Buckley, Matt Costello, Jane Patterson, Lesley Hart. A troubled young Glaswegian woman dreams of becoming a Nashville country star." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5117428/","name":"Wild Rose","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBkOTZlNmYtN2NjOS00YWM2LTk0MzMtOTEwMmIyNWIwMDA5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg3MDMxNzU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A troubled young Glaswegian woman dreams of becoming a Nashville country star.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5117428/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"evanston_dad"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life Is About Compromise","reviewBody":""Wild Rose" is perhaps a little formulaic, but I really liked the message it lands on at the end, which is that life is a series of compromises, and while few of us will ultimately achieve our dreams (if we have any to begin with), the alternative is not necessarily a life of dullness and misery.

No, despite what movies would have us believe, there is something in between. "Wild Rose" wraps things up a bit too patly -- in my actual personal experience I have not seen people as selfish as this film's heroine is suddenly turn things around and re-order her priorities. But it's nice to think that it's possible, and this is one of those films that reminds me that sometimes I turn to movies not to show me how things actually are, but how things could be.

Jessie Buckley is phenomenal in the title role. It takes a special actress to make a pretty unlikable character sympathetic and worth two hours of your time. Julie Walters is also wonderful as her fed up mom. Sophie Okonedo is stuck playing the film's most unrealistic character, a woman who is simply too good to be true.

I also liked that this movie, even if cursorily, examines the gulf that exists between people's romanticized perceptions of the entertainment world and the harsh realities of it. Anyone with an ounce of talent thinks they're special and the entire world will recognize it if they can just get their break. The reality is that talented people grow on trees, and you're most likely going nowhere if you don't know the right people and how to play the game.

Grade: A-","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12706,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2019-04-12","keywords":"singer,country music singer,train,party,release from prison","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2535701529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGYzMmUxM2MtMWZkYi00ZDk2LWFjN2YtMjI3ZDc1ZTVmMjc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGYzMmUxM2MtMWZkYi00ZDk2LWFjN2YtMjI3ZDc1ZTVmMjc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Fresh out of a stint in prison, Rose-Lynn is a single mom with an ankle monitor, a curfew, and a concerned mother (Julie Walters), who wants her to focus more on her two children and less on her music. But when Rose- Lynn tries to hold down a housekeeping job, her boss (Sophie Okonedo) hears her singing and becomes an unlikely supporter, intent on getting her to Nashville despite the long odds. Caught between hope and responsibility, Rose-Lynn must find her place without abandoning her raw talent and grand ambitions."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2976580/","name":"Jessie Buckley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0182588/","name":"Matt Costello"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10712277/","name":"Jane Patterson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2197777/","name":"Tom Harper"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0375874/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316150/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2822756/","name":"Nicole Taylor"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wander Darkly
Wander Darkly
programme.desc:
Wander Darkly: Directed by Tara Miele. With Sienna Miller, Diego Luna, Beth Grant, Brett Rice. New parents Adrienne and Matteo are forced to reckon with trauma amidst their troubled relationship. They must revisit the memories of their past and unravel haunting truths in order to face their uncertain future." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8902978/","name":"Wander Darkly","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjNkNmU2M2EtMzEwZS00M2E5LWFlOTYtZjU3ZGQ5MTU0YTM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"New parents Adrienne and Matteo are forced to reckon with trauma amidst their troubled relationship. They must revisit the memories of their past and unravel haunting truths in order to face their uncertain future.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8902978/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unusual treatment of a couple examining their commitment to each other.","reviewBody":"This movie makes sense when you know that it is mostly the writer-director's own story. She and her husband were in a bad automobile accident and when she regained consciousness she wouldn't see. Thus the title 'Wander Darkly.' She developed that experience into this fictional story.

The couple are Sienna Miller as Adrienne and Diego Luna as Matteo. They are not married but decided to have a child who is a few months old when the movie starts. They have relationship baggage that needs to get sorted out and their accident is the catalyst for that.

It would be impossible for me to write a logical narrative after viewing the movie, in many ways it is like watching a series of dream sequences. However I enjoyed it, both lead actors are very good in their roles, especially Miller.

I watched it at home on DVD from my public library. My wife skipped, she was on a golf trip."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1239,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-12-11","keywords":"trauma,newborn,funeral,flashback,fire","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Wander Darkly [trailer]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1811530009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmU0ODE1NDAtODlhOC00YjFkLWFmZjktYzNjZDVjOWJkNzg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmU0ODE1NDAtODlhOC00YjFkLWFmZjktYzNjZDVjOWJkNzg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"A traumatic accident leaves a couple, Adrienne (Sienna Miller) and Matteo (Diego Luna), in a surreal state of being that takes them on a disorienting journey through the duality of their shared moments. By reliving fond recollections from the beginning of their romance while also navigating the overwhelming truths of their present, they must rediscover the love that truly binds them together. Writer-director Tara Miele offers a profound new perspective on the delicate nature of relationships with this emotionally moving story about a couple who must reflect on their past in order to face their uncertain future."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1092227/","name":"Sienna Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0526019/","name":"Diego Luna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0335275/","name":"Beth Grant"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1301113/","name":"Tara Miele"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0655304/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0485757/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1301113/","name":"Tara Miele"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

The story of five Cuban political prisoners who had been imprisoned by the United States since the late 1990s on charges of espionage and murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6760876/","name":"Wasp Network","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWJkNjQxMjUtOGNhMC00MjJiLTg4OWQtYTdkNzYxMWE4NDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of five Cuban political prisoners who had been imprisoned by the United States since the late 1990s on charges of espionage and murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6760876/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sir_AmirSyarif"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Quite a mess","reviewBody":"Olivier Assayas' 'Wasp Network' had the opportunity for substantial dramatic material with its fascinating based-on-a-true-story plot and a star-studded cast. Unfortunately, the story is so jam-packed with various narratives and characters it becomes convoluted, confusing, and tiring to watch. Quite a mess.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9502,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-01-29","keywords":"written by director,communism,cigar smoking,spy,cuba","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1948368409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDhkNzY0MGEtMmJjZC00Yzc2LTg5ZDAtMTc2OGUxNjAyZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDhkNzY0MGEtMmJjZC00Yzc2LTg5ZDAtMTc2OGUxNjAyZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on a true and gripping story: Cuban spies infiltrate exile groups in the 1990s to stop terrorism against the island, but at a high personal cost. programme.title: Kazdy ma swoje lato
Każdy ma swoje lato
programme.desc: Kazdy ma swoje lato: Directed by Tomasz Jurkiewicz. With Nicolas Przygoda, Anita Poddebniak, Maciej Grzybowski, Sandra Drzymalska. The rebellious Agata comes to a small town to cook in an oasis. Seventeen-year-old Mirek, the son of a local organist, falls in love with her, and his grandfather, suffering from dementia, sees the girl as a lover from her youth. Mirek takes advantage of his grandfather's illness to get closer to Agata. Discovering mutual feelings unexpectedly reveals a family secret closely guarded by Mirek's mother." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13761172/","name":"Kazdy ma swoje lato","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODhiY2FkY2YtOWU1Zi00NWQyLTkwNTEtMjZkMDg1YzIyMTQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The rebellious Agata comes to a small town to cook in an oasis. programme.title: Marek Edelman... i była miłość w getcie
programme.desc: Zmarły w 2009 roku Marek Edelman był ostatnim przywódcą powstania w getcie warszawskim. Przed swoją śmiercią odpowiedział na pytanie, czy w getcie była miłość i jak ona się przejawiała. Film jest odpowiedzią na książkę Marka Edelmana i Pauli Sawickiej o tym samym tytule, która zawiera wspomnienia mężczyzny. Przy jego scenariuszu współpracowała Agnieszka Holland, a jego fabularyzowane sceny współreżyserował Andrzej Wajda.

credits.actor: Dave Hoffman

programme.title: Zmruz oczy
Zmruż oczy
programme.desc:
Zmruz oczy: Directed by Andrzej Jakimowski. With Zbigniew Zamachowski, Olga Prószynska, Rafal Guzniczak, Malgorzata Foremniak. The story of a spirited ten-year-old girl who has run away from her proudly affluent parents in town and finds grudging refuge with the slightly slovenly caretaker of an abandoned farm, an ex-teacher." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0379063/","name":"Zmruz oczy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmZjNzhhNDYtMTg1YS00YWNjLTg0MjctNTY0Zjk1ZDEyZjk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMwOTA0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of a spirited ten-year-old girl who has run away from her proudly affluent parents in town and finds grudging refuge with the slightly slovenly caretaker of an abandoned farm, an ex-teacher.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0379063/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jbig"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"A review that helps to understand the movie setting","reviewBody":"'Squint your eyes' is a movie not only about a real friendship between a caretaker and a young girl but also between different characters in the movie. 

It is set in contemporary Poland, in a rural area that has seen its better times. The main character, Jasiek is a burnt out teacher from big city. He is now a caretaker at a former soviet era co-op farm. 

Many scenes refer to this post-communist era: the dilapidated police cruiser that gets stuck in mud; the old truck that should be in the museum but out of necessity is still used for transportation.

The rest of the plot deals with the question of what will happen to the girl and her former teacher.

This is a very slow moving film without any fast, shaky camera movements. You get to feel the passage of time and the heat of the summer. The colors are beautiful; they would have been even better had they used better equipment. On the other hand the low budget, forced the director to shoot all the scenes in one take. This turned out to be a blessing since every scene is well thought out.

The director, Andrzej Jakimowski just like Kieslowski takes great care of every detail. There is a scene, hard to believe at first, where the eagle flies away. It has at least two different meanings but what is amazing that something like that actually happened to the director's father.

If you like to see an uplifting, sometimes funny, sad and quirky movie and at the same time learn about the Einstein relativity theory (the scene on the bridge) you will not be disappointed."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":895,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2003-10-24","keywords":"farm,ex teacher,rural setting,unemployment,isolation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0952498/","name":"Zbigniew Zamachowski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1437136/","name":"Olga Prószynska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1435653/","name":"Rafal Guzniczak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1435889/","name":"Andrzej Jakimowski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109608/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109606/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0126437/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1435889/","name":"Andrzej Jakimowski"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Nine Months
Dziewięć miesięcy
Nine Months
programme.desc:
Nine Months: Directed by Chris Columbus. With Hugh Grant, Julianne Moore, Tom Arnold, Joan Cusack. When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113986/","name":"Nine Months","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2U3YTQzYWYtZTBlYi00ZmJjLTkzMjAtOTljYmE5MThhNzk5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113986/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philip_vanderveken"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just a poor girl movie","reviewBody":"Thanks a lot Hollywood for making me feel like I'm not worth much. No, I'm not a father yet, but if my girlfriend would tell me that she's pregnant, my world would probably almost collapse at the first moment and apparently that's not the way you should react. This movie tries to make you believe that having a child is everybody's moral duty. We all should make a few dozen babies to find eternal happiness. I'm very sorry but that is just a bunch of ultra conservative Christian crap!!! I know, my reaction is perhaps a bit strong, but this time it all really bothered me too much.

At first the movie starts very promising. It's funny to see how he reacts when he hears the news that she's pregnant, that his perfectly organized life will be completely turned upside down, ... but as the movie progresses it gets a pedantic tone, which I really didn't like. I agree that the movie had funny parts (for instance the praying mantis part was absolutely brilliant), but it never seemed to stick to a certain genre. Sometimes it was slapstick, than drama, than comedy, than a romantic movie... What bothered me about this movie as well, is the use of so many stereotypes. Men are pigs when it comes to having children, babies are miracles, a man acts and reacts like a child... 

All in all this is just a poor girl movie that confirms many of their ideas about men and children. It has some decent, but far from excellent acting in it, but doesn't know where it wants to go. I give it a 5/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36215,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1995-07-12","keywords":"time for title,bad dream,close up of eyes,close up of lips,close up of mouth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Nine Months","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2812084505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjljYWMxZTUtNTQxYy00Yjc2LWI3MDEtYTNiYTQzMDZiMzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjljYWMxZTUtNTQxYy00Yjc2LWI3MDEtYTNiYTQzMDZiMzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000424/","name":"Hugh Grant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000792/","name":"Tom Arnold"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0105317/","name":"Patrick Braoudé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paper Towns
Papierowe miasta
Paper Towns
programme.desc: Paper Towns: Directed by Jake Schreier. With Nat Wolff, Cara Delevingne, Austin Abrams, Justice Smith. After an all-night adventure, Quentin's lifelong crush, Margo, disappears, leaving behind clues that Quentin and his friends follow on the journey of a lifetime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3622592/","name":"Paper Towns","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE2ODQxODMwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDY5NjY3NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After an all-night adventure, Quentin's lifelong crush, Margo, disappears, leaving behind clues that Quentin and his friends follow on the journey of a lifetime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3622592/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"matthewssilverhammer"},"dateCreated":"2015-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Maybe I'm just getting old...","reviewBody":"Maybe I'm getting old. These over-serious, platitude-filled teen dramas used to only mildly annoy me. Now, with Paper Towns, I feel myself getting irrationally angry at its desperate plea to be this generation's The Breakfast Club. From where is that resentment coming? Maybe it's that I'm a 30-year-old married-father who's not meant to like this movie. Maybe it's that I'm coming off the high of the teen drama Me and Earl and the Dying Girl. Whatever it is, Paper Towns irritated much more than it charmed. The premise has potential: nerd spends one magically frivolous night with the enigmatic girl of his dreams, Margot, before she inexplicably disappears. Instead of being unique, stylish, or progressive, it becomes the lament of the rich-white-teen and the manic pixie dream girl. Our "hero" is drawn to her magnetic mystery, but that appeal never reaches the audience. At times, she represents an idea more than a character, but mostly she's an unbearably selfish, manipulative shrew, using her womanly wiles to get whatever she needs. When she's off-screen, the interplay between the friends is watchable, but her bothersome presence is never far away. Worst yet, in the end PT never takes a stance on Margot, like the movie is trying to have its cake and eat it too. Stylistically, the movie is forcefully quirky, annoyingly cutesy, and boasts a soundtrack that's like someone pushed the "hipster" button on a Casio Keyboard. We can only blame director Schreier, whose previous film was the under-seen Robot and Frank. Just stay home and watch that, a story about a machine with more humanity than anyone in PT.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":99319,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-07-24","keywords":"based on novel,travel,teenage girl,unrequited love,friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2452795417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNjAxNDc3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxNDg4NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNjAxNDc3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxNDg4NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A coming-of-age story centering on Quentin and his enigmatic neighbor Margo, who loved mysteries so much she became one. After taking him on an all-night adventure through their hometown, Margo suddenly disappears - leaving behind cryptic clues for Quentin to decipher. The search leads Quentin and his quick-witted friends on an exhilarating adventure that is equal parts hilarious and moving. Ultimately, to track down Margo, Quentin must find a deeper understanding of true friendship - and true love."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1822659/","name":"Nat Wolff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5353321/","name":"Cara Delevingne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3641002/","name":"Austin Abrams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500577/","name":"Jake Schreier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069651/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2354099/","name":"Scott Neustadter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2352210/","name":"Michael H. Weber"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1981261/","name":"John Green"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Pianist
Pianista
The Pianist
programme.desc:
The Pianist: Directed by Roman Polanski. With Adrien Brody, Emilia Fox, Michal Zebrowski, Ed Stoppard. A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253474/","name":"The Pianist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRiZDIxZjktMTA1NC00MDQ2LWEzMjUtMTliZmY3NjQ3ODJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FilmOtaku"},"dateCreated":"2003-04-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"An astonishing film","reviewBody":"The Pianist is the true story of Wladyslaw Szpilman, at the time Poland's most acclaimed pianist whose life is transformed during the Nazi occupation of Warsaw beginning in 1939. The film spans several years and maps his many personal trials in addition to providing the perspectives of his family, rebel factions and sympathizers.

Brilliantly directed by Roman Polanski and starring an amazing Adrien Brody, The Pianist is bound to garner comparisons to Schindler's List, for obvious reasons. However similar the subject matter, the approach is different. While Schindler's List was filmed in a beautiful, crisp black and white that offered many incredible images, The Pianist was filmed with almost muted color. Schindler's List featured what has been argued as a complicated hero. Oskar Schindler did save many Jews, but not without battling his own materialistic demons first. The Pianist's Szpilman is a sympathetic character throughout. His plight was desperate, and the demons he fought were over his own guilt in surviving a fight that eventually turns into a primal will to live.

Polanski does not spare the viewer any grief with his film. The horrific scenes between the Nazis and the Warsaw Jews were more terrifying and horrible than any horror/suspense movie I have seen in some time, possibly ever. The humiliation and complete loss is wrenching. In several scenes, Jews are lined up in the middle of the night and subjected to either torture or death. In one case, a woman asks of a Nazi officer, "What will happen to us?" and is promptly shot point blank in the head. The camera does not flinch or subdue any of these atrocities.

A mention must be made of Brody's performance. Having only previously seen Brody in two other films, Spike Lee's "Summer of Sam" and Terrence Malick's "The Thin Red Line" (a part that was supposed to be his launch into stardom before his part was unfortunately cut drastically) I knew his potential was great. After his Oscar win, I viewed this movie with more criticism than I normally would have and he certainly did not disappoint. He transcended my expectations. His physical transformation was amazing, but more importantly, he conveyed the sorrow of this man shockingly well - in both verbal and non-verbal contexts. It will be very interesting to see what kind of opportunities this role will afford him, and the kinds of roles he will accept.

Something worth mentioning is the affect this movie had on the audience with whom I viewed this film. Normally, when a film ends, the regular hardcore filmsters like myself will stay and watch the credits in their entirety. The rest of the audience stands up and leaves, usually to the chagrin of the remaining enthusiasts. This was one of the few times I have seen a film at a theater where not one person stood to leave during the final credits. It wasn't until the house lights came up at the end did people begin to disperse. Personally, I hightailed it out of the theater the second the lights came on because not only was my face a mess from crying during the film (Tammy Faye comes to mind) but I had this overwhelming need for an emotional release, so when I reached my car I sat and wept for about five minutes. It has been years since I have watched a film that upset me to that extent. Conversely, while discussing this film with my brother, (someone who loves movies as much and has similar tastes as I do) he mentioned that while he thought the movie was excellent, he wasn't as profoundly emotionally effected as I was. After thinking about this for a couple of days, I realized the difference: The music. As a classical music enthusiast and erstwhile musician, the thought of not being able to enjoy, much less play the music you love is a tragic one. Then the emotional outpouring that comes when you return to it - there aren't words to describe how intense that is. Not having the same appreciation for this musical genre, one will be able to sympathize with the physical and emotional tribulations, but perhaps not in the musical sense.

The Pianist was truly an astonishing film. I was riveted from start to finish and so emotionally affected that I couldn't even consider writing a review until a week later. Having said that, I am filing this away with my list of movies which include Schindlers List and Philadelphia, as films that I love but cannot rewatch for a long time after due to their intensely emotional content.

--Shelly","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":773505,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"contentRating":"(Banned)","genre":["Biography","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"pianist,holocaust,survival,nazi occupied poland,person in a wheelchair falls from height","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Pianist","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi988938521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Focus Features"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004778/","name":"Adrien Brody"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470981/","name":"Thomas Kretschmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277975/","name":"Frank Finlay"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024473/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030304/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367838/","name":"Ronald Harwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0844262/","name":"Wladyslaw Szpilman"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Proxima
Proxima
programme.desc: Proxima: Directed by Alice Winocour. With Eva Green, Zélie Boulant, Matt Dillon, Aleksey Fateev. An astronaut prepares for a one-year mission aboard the International Space Station." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7374926/","name":"Proxima","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjkxOTc2M2ItODI4ZC00ZDVmLTg1ZGMtMDczNTYyNzg4Nzk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"An astronaut prepares for a one-year mission aboard the International Space Station.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7374926/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Uneventful and unremarkable melodrama.","reviewBody":"I was really disappointed with this rather dull, dreary documentary-style story about "Sarah" (Eva Green) who has dreamed since she was a child of going into space. When her opportunity arrives, she must face the rigours of the training, segregation and quarantine which hit her much harder than she had anticipated - and cause her to miss her young daughter, the rather engaging Zélie Boulant ("Stella") dreadfully. The problem with this film is that aside from some pictures of the Kazakh spaceport and some weight-water training, it could be about absolutely anything. Any mother (or, indeed father) who has to dedicate themself unconditionally to a job might reasonably feel the same senses of loneliness and despair and though Eva Green (or rather, her eyes) do manage to convey some of the sheer exhaustion her character might be feeling during this extensive period of preparation, again it could be for an ultra-marathon or a cross-channel swim! It's been a while since I've seen Matt Dillon on screen, and he adds nothing to this vanity project for polyglots.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6646,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-11-27","keywords":"female astronaut,male astronaut,mother daughter relationship,cat,swimming pool","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2393030169","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzZTI0MGEtNzQ3Yy00MTdjLWIyZTYtNjZmYTU0ZWViMGI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzZTI0MGEtNzQ3Yy00MTdjLWIyZTYtNjZmYTU0ZWViMGI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Eva Green gives a career best performance in this epic and emotionally charged new drama from acclaimed director Alice Winocour. Green plays Sarah, a French astronaut training at the European Space Agency in Cologne. The only woman in the arduous programme she has been chosen to be part of the crew of a year-long space mission called ‘Proxima’. Putting enormous strain on her relationship with her daughter (played by outstanding newcomer Zélie Boulant-Lemesle), the training begins to take its toll on both as Sarah’s training progresses and the launch looms ever closer."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1200692/","name":"Eva Green"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5541157/","name":"Zélie Boulant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000369/","name":"Matt Dillon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1356951/","name":"Alice Winocour"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0091516/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0401721/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1356951/","name":"Alice Winocour"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0111379/","name":"Jean-Stéphane Bron"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: There's Something About Mary
Sposób na blondynkę
There's Something About Mary
programme.desc: There's Something About Mary: Directed by Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly. With Cameron Diaz, Matt Dillon, Ben Stiller, Lee Evans. A man gets a chance to meet up with his dream girl from high school, even though his date with her back then was a complete disaster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0129387/","name":"There's Something About Mary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWFlZjE5OTYtNWY0ZC00MzgzLTg5MjUtYTFkZjk2NjJkYjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man gets a chance to meet up with his dream girl from high school, even though his date with her back then was a complete disaster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0129387/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chris J."},"dateCreated":"1998-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny, but surprisingly sweet too.","reviewBody":"The shock comedy aside (zipper and hair gel scenes), purposeful unpolitically correct moments (humor at expense of handicapped, animal cruelty), the most surprising thing about this film is it has heart and is rather sweet. It's not the completely nasty, cruel comedy you might have been expecting. There's a nice love story in here too. It's corny and cliche'd and doesn't feel overly cloying because there are enough shockingly funny moments to offset it. The acting is good, the pacing brisk, and the jokes, well... you've heard all about the best ones by now.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":301379,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1998-07-15","keywords":"love triangle,original story,black man white woman marriage,penis caught in zipper,ejaculation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000369/","name":"Matt Dillon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0214036/","name":"Ed Decter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0833828/","name":"John J. It's not the completely nasty, cruel comedy you might have been expecting. There's a nice love story in here too. It's corny and cliche'd and doesn't feel overly cloying because there are enough shockingly funny moments to offset it. programme.title: One of a Kind Love
Jedyna taka miłość
One of a Kind Love
programme.desc:
One of a Kind Love: Directed by Philippe Lupien. With Jocelyn Hudon, Jake Manley, Daniela Sandiford, Raphael Grosz-Harvey. Kyra's dreams of being a jeweler have been put on the backburner, as her demanding job at the Sawyer Country Club is her priority. When a vacant shop becomes available in town, Kyra sees an opportunity to put a plan into action, until she learns that there's another renter interested in the space. Enter Aiden Sawyer, prodigal son, big-city business magnate and Kyra's childhood nemesis, returning home to the country club his parents own. As they patch up their past, Kyra and Aiden learn that there may be something more between them than just playful flirting. But when Kyra enters a renowned jewelry contest to raise enough money to outbid the mystery renter, Aiden finds himself in a race against time to make everything right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13012364/","name":"One of a Kind Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGY4MWQwNTEtOTEzMC00NDdjLWIwMTItMzcyZDhiMWNiM2JmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Kyra's dreams of being a jeweler have been put on the backburner, as her demanding job at the Sawyer Country Club is her priority. When a vacant shop becomes available in town, Kyra sees an opportunity to put a plan into action, unti","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13012364/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ssimeonidou1"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sweet movie!","reviewBody":"Everything in this film is good enough! The script has a pleasant and quick plot, the cast is good, the scenery is beautiful and the leading actors are sweet, good looking and well suited for the characters they portray! They definetely have chemistry!!!

You can understand from the first moment Kyra and Eidan will have their happy ending, with the usual misunderstanding near the end of the movie but.... has a nice twist.... instead the usual format where this keeps going on and on..... Eidan who in fact protected her dream, explains everything to her honestly and Kyra doesn't hesitate to fall in his arms in a hot kissing moment!!!

The only thing i didn't like was the jewelry!!! Ha ha Enjoy!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":170,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2021-04-28","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"One of a Kind Love","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1855701017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRiMjYxYWItNzdmNy00YTk3LWIyYjktYjg3ZDNiMTk2YWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRiMjYxYWItNzdmNy00YTk3LWIyYjktYjg3ZDNiMTk2YWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance/Comedy TV Movie

programme.title: Songbird
Songbird. Rozdzieleni
Songbird
programme.desc: Songbird: Directed by Adam Mason. With K.J. Apa, Sofia Carson, Craig Robinson, Bradley Whitford. In 2024 a pandemic ravages the world and its cities. Centering on a handful of people as they navigate the obstacles currently hindering society: disease, martial law, quarantine, and vigilantes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12592252/","name":"Songbird","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDA1MTYxNjctYjQyOS00OTQ2LWFkNGMtMmZkNDg0ZDNjNDYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY1MTg4Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 2024 a pandemic ravages the world and its cities. Centering on a handful of people as they navigate the obstacles currently hindering society: disease, martial law, quarantine, and vigilantes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12592252/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fortunefox"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining!","reviewBody":"Ok so it's not Oscar material but that being said it was really good! It was thrilling and it kept my attention. In this age of Covid this movie is a must see. I'm glad I didn't listen to the reviews. programme.title: Cleo
Cleo
programme.desc: Cleo: Directed by Eva Cools. With Anna Franziska Jaeger, Roy Aernouts, Martha Canga Antonio, Natali Broods. Cleo is trying to pick her life back up after a devastating car crash which kills her parents. She is raised with her brother by their grandmother and meets an older guy in a night club who seems to understand the struggle she is in." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7933442/","name":"Cleo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDI3Y2FmMmEtN2NkMS00OWU5LWFhZDEtZDA4MDg2MTFlYmJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzM3NDI3._V1_.jpg","description":"Cleo is trying to pick her life back up after a devastating car crash which kills her parents. She is raised with her brother by their grandmother and meets an older guy in a night club who seems to understand the struggle she is in.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7933442/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mariusbv-35612"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Impressive Story","reviewBody":"Thanks God there are movies like this one! I'm sick and tired of all those cheap, predictable stories where special effects are more important than the actual script. It also made me more receptive to classical music. I admit it's a little bit heavy and dark and dramatic at times, but hey... all great stories are! A girl would love it anyways. Emo/goth teens too. It's a well-done art movie where actors did their job as they are suplosed to and the atmosphere is very distinctive, special and personal. programme.desc: Countdown: Directed by Justin Dec. With Elizabeth Lail, Jordan Calloway, Talitha Eliana Bateman, Peter Facinelli. When a nurse downloads an app that claims to predict the moment a person will die, it tells her she only has three days to live. With the clock ticking and a figure haunting her, she must find a way to save her life before time runs out." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10039344/","name":"Countdown","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODY3OGEyMTgtYTZjZi00Y2YzLWFjY2UtMjEwYWE1MjRkOTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODQxMTI4MjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a nurse downloads an app that claims to predict the moment a person will die, it tells her she only has three days to live. With the clock ticking and a figure haunting her, she must find a way to save her life before time runs ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10039344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bandblawrw"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Actually pretty good for PG 13","reviewBody":"Great times when a movie completely surprises you by being good. PG 13 horror movies tend to be mediocre but #Countdown was really good. A bit more to the plot than the trailers implied. Witty (snarky) dialogue and a great group of unknowns, with two great veterans dropped into the mix, Tichina Arnold and Peter Facinelli, whom I didn't even know were in the film. As a teen movie, everyone is gorgeous *eye candy* but the twist in the movie gave it more depth than anticipated. Two peripheral characters added an unexpected comic appeal for a "horror" movie. I think the Happy Death Day franchise has spun off a new genre "com-horror" maybe? Anyway, on a regular movie scale this is maybe a 7? but for the PG 13 horror rankings, a solid 9. Great date movie, as there is no nudity, or a movie to see with a group of friends for laughs and jump scares.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31259,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-10-25","keywords":"violence,race against time,sexual harassment at work,boss sexually harassing employee,sexually harassed by one's boss","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2813181721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA1NWIxMGYtYzdhMC00Yjg3LWE1Y2MtNDAxYTE0YmM3ZGQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA1NWIxMGYtYzdhMC00Yjg3LWE1Y2MtNDAxYTE0YmM3ZGQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a young nurse downloads an app that claims to predict exactly \nwhen a person is going to die, it tells her she only has three days to live. With the clock ticking and a figure haunting her, she must find a way to save her life before time runs out." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10039344/","name":"Countdown","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODY3OGEyMTgtYTZjZi00Y2YzLWFjY2UtMjEwYWE1MjRkOTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODQxMTI4MjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a nurse downloads an app that claims to predict the moment a person will die, it tells her she only has three days to live. With the clock ticking and a figure haunting her, she must find a way to save her life before time runs ","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10039344/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"bandblawrw","dateCreated":"2019-10-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Actually pretty good for PG 13","reviewBody":"Great times when a movie completely surprises you by being good. PG 13 horror movies tend to be mediocre but #Countdown was really good. A bit more to the plot than the trailers implied. Witty (snarky) dialogue and a great group of unknowns, with two great veterans dropped into the mix, Tichina Arnold and Peter Facinelli, whom I didn't even know were in the film. As a teen movie, everyone is gorgeous *eye candy* but the twist in the movie gave it more depth than anticipated. Two peripheral characters added an unexpected comic appeal for a "horror" movie. I think the Happy Death Day franchise has spun off a new genre "com-horror" maybe? Anyway, on a regular movie scale this is maybe a 7? but for the PG 13 horror rankings, a solid 9. A remake of the 2014 Danish film 'Silent Heart'." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8717446/","name":"Blackbird","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDk1OTQ5MjAtNzM5Ny00YTFhLWJiNzYtMjZhNWZmMGU0M2YwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDExMzMxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A terminally ill mother arranges to bring her family together one last time before she dies. After all these years I still tear up during certain scenes. That never happened here. Not even almost! I actually think I dosed off for a minute somewhere in the middle of it. Joining the collective farewell are Lily’s son in law (Rainn Wilson), her lifelong friend (Lindsay Duncan), daughter’s partner (Bex Taylor-Klaus) and grandson (Anson Boon). Her story is ultimately one of hope, love and a celebration of life."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000554/","name":"Sam Neill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000215/","name":"Susan Sarandon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6978918/","name":"Anson Boon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0585011/","name":"Roger Michell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0403784/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147213/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0646497/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1311535/","name":"Christian Torpe"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Pappa
programme.desc: Countdown: Directed by Justin Dec. With Elizabeth Lail, Jordan Calloway, Talitha Eliana Bateman, Peter Facinelli. When a nurse downloads an app that claims to predict the moment a person will die, it tells her she only has three days to live. With the clock ticking and a figure haunting her, she must find a way to save her life before time runs out." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10039344/","name":"Countdown","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODY3OGEyMTgtYTZjZi00Y2YzLWFjY2UtMjEwYWE1MjRkOTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODQxMTI4MjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a nurse downloads an app that claims to predict the moment a person will die, it tells her she only has three days to live. With the clock ticking and a figure haunting her, she must find a way to save her life before time runs ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10039344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bandblawrw"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Actually pretty good for PG 13","reviewBody":"Great times when a movie completely surprises you by being good. PG 13 horror movies tend to be mediocre but #Countdown was really good. A bit more to the plot than the trailers implied. Witty (snarky) dialogue and a great group of unknowns, with two great veterans dropped into the mix, Tichina Arnold and Peter Facinelli, whom I didn't even know were in the film. As a teen movie, everyone is gorgeous *eye candy* but the twist in the movie gave it more depth than anticipated. Two peripheral characters added an unexpected comic appeal for a "horror" movie. I think the Happy Death Day franchise has spun off a new genre "com-horror" maybe? Anyway, on a regular movie scale this is maybe a 7? but for the PG 13 horror rankings, a solid 9. Great date movie, as there is no nudity, or a movie to see with a group of friends for laughs and jump scares.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31259,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-10-25","keywords":"violence,race against time,sexual harassment at work,boss sexually harassing employee,sexually harassed by one's boss","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2813181721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA1NWIxMGYtYzdhMC00Yjg3LWE1Y2MtNDAxYTE0YmM3ZGQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA1NWIxMGYtYzdhMC00Yjg3LWE1Y2MtNDAxYTE0YmM3ZGQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a young nurse downloads an app that claims to predict exactly \nwhen a person is going to die, it tells her she only has three days to live. programme.title: Blackbird

Blackbird
programme.desc: Blackbird: Directed by Roger Michell. With Sam Neill, Susan Sarandon, Anson Boon, Kate Winslet. A terminally ill mother arranges to bring her family together one last time before she dies. A remake of the 2014 Danish film 'Silent Heart'." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8717446/","name":"Blackbird","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDk1OTQ5MjAtNzM5Ny00YTFhLWJiNzYtMjZhNWZmMGU0M2YwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDExMzMxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A terminally ill mother arranges to bring her family together one last time before she dies. A remake of the 2014 Danish film 'Silent Heart'.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8717446/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elishawin2005"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Coulda, woulda, shoulda...been better","reviewBody":"Do you remember Susan Sarandon in the movie Stepmom with Julia Roberts? After all these years I still tear up during certain scenes. That never happened here. Not even almost! I actually think I dosed off for a minute somewhere in the middle of it. It felt like they just had to fill in some open space just to finally get to the departure. I wouldn't watch it again and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone else.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3741,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-18","keywords":"euthanasia,family gathering,terminal illness,assisted suicide,remake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi912113177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI3MGQyYTEtOTI2MS00MTg5LTk0MTItMDlkMjMyOGYzMDZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI3MGQyYTEtOTI2MS00MTg5LTk0MTItMDlkMjMyOGYzMDZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"Lily (Susan Sarandon) and Paul (Sam Neill) summon their loved ones to their beach house for one final gathering after Lily decides to end her long lbattle with ALS. The couple is planning a loving weekend complete with holiday traditions, but the mood becomes strained when unresolved issues surface between Lily and her daughters Jennifer (Kate Winslet) and Anna (Mia Wasikowska). Joining the collective farewell are Lily’s son in law (Rainn Wilson), her lifelong friend (Lindsay Duncan), daughter’s partner (Bex Taylor-Klaus) and grandson (Anson Boon). Her story is ultimately one of hope, love and a celebration of life."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000554/","name":"Sam Neill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000215/","name":"Susan Sarandon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6978918/","name":"Anson Boon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0585011/","name":"Roger Michell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0403784/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147213/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0646497/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1311535/","name":"Christian Torpe"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Help
Pomoc
Help

programme.title: La muerte de un perro
Śmierć psa
La Muerte de Un Perro

programme.title: Oleg
Oleg
programme.desc:
Oleg: Directed by Juris Kursietis. With Valentin Novopolskij, Dawid Ogrodnik, Anna Próchniak, Guna Zarina. A young Latvian butcher travels to Brussels in search of better wage but a series of misfortunes lead him to fall under the sway of a Polish criminal." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7714770/","name":"Oleg","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTRmNzQ1YmItZjdiMC00ODZhLTk5ZTAtNjI1NTAwZGE1OTI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDE1MTYxNjk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young Latvian butcher travels to Brussels in search of better wage but a series of misfortunes lead him to fall under the sway of a Polish criminal.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7714770/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MarcoParzivalRocha"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"The life of many migrants","reviewBody":"Oleg, a young man from Latvia, travels to Brussels in search of a better life, however, a series of misfortunes causes him to fall into the hands of an unscrupulous criminal.

Although the pertinent and very current message, Oleg fails in some certain points, and because of that, the film can't reach the high level, so to speak, lacking the reflective and emotional tone, but still, the film leaves interesting notes along the way.

The narrative focus on a story that is not new, of someone looking for something more in life, especially at the financial level, subjecting himself to exploitation and abuse.

It's the point of view from the citizens of the East Europe, and how the most advanced European countries treat "outsiders", and how acceptance and integration are mere illusions for them.

The cinematography adopts a style similar to a documentary, with very closed shots, giving a feeling of claustrophobia and constant pursuit, which works well.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":838,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-10-04","keywords":"immigrant,butcher,mob,brussels belgium","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3239511/","name":"Valentin Novopolskij"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4221607/","name":"Dawid Ogrodnik"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4452669/","name":"Anna Próchniak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3302367/","name":"Juris Kursietis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0477054/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0213940/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0403374/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9550101/","name":"Liga Celma-Kursiete"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3302367/","name":"Juris Kursietis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1213663/","name":"Kaspars Odins"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

Mila
programme.desc: Mila: Directed by Christos Nikou. With Aris Servetalis, Sofia Georgovassili, Anna Kalaitzidou, Argyris Bakirtzis. Amidst a worldwide pandemic that causes sudden amnesia, middle-aged Aris finds himself enrolled in a recovery program designed to help unclaimed patients build new identities." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10110614/","name":"Mila","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjYxZjdlMDYtYWFjMC00YjE2LWIzMTAtZTlmNjYzMzYwMTA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDc2NTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Amidst a worldwide pandemic that causes sudden amnesia, middle-aged Aris finds himself enrolled in a recovery program designed to help unclaimed patients build new identities.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10110614/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mehobulls"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"It has the strangeness inherent in a Yorgos Lanthimos film, but this one's a charmer.","reviewBody":"A dash of Philip K. Dick & Julio Cortazar (Disturbed Memory Department of the Neurological Hospital) and lots of Greek Weird Wave clichés - deadpan humor, doom and gloom, alienation, grief, identity-crisis, ennui etc. Alas, Apples lacks the haunting sadism of Lanthimos and Makridis' films which could make it more palatable to a wider audience. Nikou's suggestion - amnesia is not a disease, but a cure - is intriguing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2760,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2021-06-03","keywords":"one word title,apple,amnesia,memory,in memoriam","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer for Apples","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2286599705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjY1NWM3MWMtZDNkNC00NDFlLThjYjUtNTliOWQ4MWExMjhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWdhbWF6b2E@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjY1NWM3MWMtZDNkNC00NDFlLThjYjUtNTliOWQ4MWExMjhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWdhbWF6b2E@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Venice Orizzonti film, Apples"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1160306/","name":"Aris Servetalis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3218921/","name":"Sofia Georgovassili"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2801340/","name":"Anna Kalaitzidou"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3649532/","name":"Christos Nikou"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0263183/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0349562/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0185099/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3649532/","name":"Christos Nikou"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3242193/","name":"Stavros Raptis"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: No Coração do Mundo
Serce świata
No coração do mundo
programme.desc: No Coração do Mundo: Directed by Gabriel Martins, Maurílio Martins. With Kelly Crifer, Leo Pyrata, Grace Passô, Bárbara Colen. The inhabitants of the Brazilian city of Contagem yearn for a better life. At the core of it all is Selma, a woman dreaming about the heart of the world: it could be anywhere, as long as it's a place where to feel happier." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9646768/","name":"No Coração do Mundo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODY2MWQzOWMtYmE3ZS00NGM2LWFkYTAtOTQ3MDU4MmI0NTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTc4OTI5MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The inhabitants of the Brazilian city of Contagem yearn for a better life. At the core of it all is Selma, a woman dreaming about the heart of the world: it could be anywhere, as long as it's a place where to feel happier.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9646768/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"guisreis"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Inside periphery, with real people","reviewBody":"Interesting and varied characters deeply developped in a realistic periphery in the town Contagem. The beginning is amazing, and the way we gradually know the different characters, how they are related to each other, and their lives is very engaging. Their existences are far from desired and they want to be somewhere else: if the needed profit will come from a new work or through a great crime, that will vary. Indeed, borders between crime and honest work are not always so rigid, and both are neighbors. Action scenes are as good as the daily routine ones, and here I saw one of the very best shooting footage. The only drawback, in my opinion, is that there are too many side stories which are not developped until the end, and some kmportant events are never explained or are just forgotten. The film is quite well directed and has excellent actors, and listening Minas Gerais accent is very nice.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":328,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-08-01","keywords":"male frontal nudity,male nudity,male rear nudity,female nudity,fireworks","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In the Heart of the World (Official Trailer 2019)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2546908697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVlZDY2ZDktM2UxMC00ZGE4LTljYWUtYzcwNDhkMjZiMTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVlZDY2ZDktM2UxMC00ZGE4LTljYWUtYzcwNDhkMjZiMTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7108471/","name":"Kelly Crifer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4911970/","name":"Leo Pyrata"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4498129/","name":"Grace Passô"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5506211/","name":"Gabriel Martins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5668454/","name":"Maurílio Martins"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0432382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5506211/","name":"Gabriel Martins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5668454/","name":"Maurílio Martins"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hud
Hud, syn farmera
Hud
programme.desc: Hud: Directed by Martin Ritt. With Paul Newman, Melvyn Douglas, Patricia Neal, Brandon De Wilde. Honest and hard-working Texas rancher Homer Bannon has a conflict with his unscrupulous, selfish, arrogant and egotistical son Hud, who sank into alcoholism after accidentally killing his brother in a car crash." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0057163/","name":"Hud","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA3MzFlZDQtNTY3Ny00OTM1LWI1ODctNmE4ZWM5ZTU2MjA5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Honest and hard-working Texas rancher Homer Bannon has a conflict with his unscrupulous, selfish, arrogant and egotistical son Hud, who sank into alcoholism after accidentally killing his brother in a car crash.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0057163/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"terencebells"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Hard Western Look","reviewBody":"I knew I had seen it, I had a black and white James Wong Howe Cinemascope memory and Paul Newman's body language. How he walks, how he stands. I remember thinking that Jake Gyllenhaal had borrowed that physicality for his character in "Brokeback Mountain" and I just realized that Larry McMurtry is the author of both "Brokeback Mountain" and "Hud". He provides us with a look into the modern cowboy that is not only unique but mesmerizing. Paul Newman's Hud is a cad and yet you feel we sense that behind the bravado hides a desperate man looking for something. Something personal and unspoken. Hud is one of my favorite Newman performances. Soulless and yet needy. Is it a coincidence that the only woman that"got away" from Hud is named Alma? - Alma in Spanish means soul - Alma is played by Patricia Neal with power and humanity and she won the Oscar for it. Melvyn Douglas also won the Oscar for his superb performance and Brandon de Wilde deserved one of his own. He is extraordinary. Hud has become an important film in my life and in future viewings in years to come I may discover why.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20969,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"Passed","genre":["Drama","Western"],"datePublished":"1963-05-29","keywords":"rodeo cowboy,neo western,texas,rodeo,jack daniels","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2435365401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzcwOTJlMWUtZWIxOS00NTJkLTk0YjUtYjE0MGNlOTZjNTdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRzdGFzaWVr._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzcwOTJlMWUtZWIxOS00NTJkLTk0YjUtYjE0MGNlOTZjNTdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRzdGFzaWVr._V1_.jpg","description":"Honest and hard-working Texas rancher Homer Bannon has a conflict with his unscrupulous, selfish, arrogant and egotistical son Hud, who sank into alcoholism after accidentally killing his brother in a car crash."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000056/","name":"Paul Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002048/","name":"Melvyn Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0623658/","name":"Patricia Neal"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728688/","name":"Martin Ritt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057370/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712419/","name":"Irving Ravetch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290809/","name":"Harriet Frank Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0573505/","name":"Larry McMurtry"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

Sztuka kradzieży
The Art of the Steal
programme.desc: The Art of the Steal: Directed by Jonathan Sobol. With Kurt Russell, Matt Dillon, Jay Baruchel, Kenneth Welsh. Crunch Calhoun, a semi-reformed art thief, agrees to get his old gang back together to pull off one last heist." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2172985/","name":"The Art of the Steal","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjUxNjYyNTUxMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDgyMDcyMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Crunch Calhoun, a semi-reformed art thief, agrees to get his old gang back together to pull off one last heist.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2172985/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michael-yates-88-308634"},"dateCreated":"2014-02-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fantastic Heist Movie...good Twist ...Loved it!","reviewBody":"If you love heist movies like me then you will love this one...without spoiling, it has all the ingredients for a good heist movie: protagonist is hard done by antagonist; trust is burnt; work together again for a big score; can they trust each other again? But what I like about this movies is the intricate story...there are things afoot and they're not twelve inches...Can you work it out? I had a rough idea without working out the details but I still loved it.... works much better than Now You See Me in my opinion...has a B grade movie feel but an A grade kick in the pants at the end...I do like Kurt Russell and Matt Dillon. And it is great to see Kenneth Welsh...A very Good Movie...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":24210,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2014-06-20","keywords":"heist,thief,motorcycle,hiding in a car trunk,interpol","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Art of the Steal","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1849604633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjk4OTE0OWUtODYyNS00MmYzLWJmNjYtZmZiNGI4ZTU1MWZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjk4OTE0OWUtODYyNS00MmYzLWJmNjYtZmZiNGI4ZTU1MWZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The Art of the Steal"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000621/","name":"Kurt Russell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0059431/","name":"Jay Baruchel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0935395/","name":"Katheryn Winnick"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1038286/","name":"Jonathan Sobol"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0150452/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026545/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1038286/","name":"Jonathan Sobol"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="
